required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of CO2 Exchange Patterns During Robotic Prostatectomies
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparative Study of CO2 Exchange Patterns Between Valve-free Trocar (AirSeal®) Versus Standard Trocar (Endopath®) During Robotic Prostatectomies

brief_summary.textblock: The AirSeal® System will allow for lower CO2 absorption rates than the Xcel® System. Furthermore, lower variance in pneumoperitoneal pressure will allow for less "over-pressure" events and peritoneal stretch, which may reduce postoperative pain.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary observation to be made is the level of PaCO2 in the arterial blood, specifically when the patient is insufflated and deflated during the surgery. As a result of the consistent pressure that the AirSeal® system maintains, CO2 will be absorbed in lower levels when compared to the standard of care systems in which fluctuations in intra-peritoneum pressure are seen. Therefore, higher pressures will result in higher levels of CO2 exchange in the blood, leading to increased vasodilation and lower pH levels.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.description: Compare the maximum intraoperative pneumoperitoneal pressure (mmHg), smoke evacuation quality (categorical), and overall operative times (minutes) between the conventional and valve-less trocar groups.

arm_group.description: This group receives the AirSeal System for intraoperative insufflation.
This group receives the Standard Endopath Trocar for intraoperative insufflation.

intervention.description: To analyze the results of patients randomized to either the AirSeal system or Standard Endopath trocar.
This group receives the Standard Endopath Trocar for intraoperative insufflation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age>18
- Eligible and elect to undergo robotic prostatectomy surgery @ OhioHealth Dublin Methodist Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18
- Emergency surgery
- Ascites
- BMI>44 or <18
